positive.review: I can start with this probably isn't for everyone, and winning is not a common place for me in this game. HOWEVER, it is very cute, feels pretty mindless to me, and somehow makes me continue to try to win even when I haven't in like 50 rounds.
this game is good for critical thinking but one downside, it gets old pretty fast.
Good game, its auto and super, the pets that is

Fun game that is extremely addictive. I've sunk hundreds of hours into it, and probably will continue to sink more. Appreciate that the devs continue to add content and balance, but it seems like they are never going to be finished with that and it feels a bit cash grabby.
Awesome auto battler, especially the earlier packs. Would love it if they added steam achievements.

A very fun free to play game that is simple to learn but hard to master. It's quite difficult to get any wins against other opponents but I have enjoyed the artstyle and progression. I don't feel the need to buy anything but you can if you wanna support the devs. What I appriciate is the cross-progression to mobile, just like marvel snap that I play a lot. I just used my google account to set it up and now I can play on mobile and steamdeck or PC and the game saves my progress as I go, works smoothly! If you like auto battlers this is a no-brainer to test since It's free and not demanding to run.

If you want to waste some time this game is pretty fun.  It is also super frustrating as you keep getting the worst picks over and over again.  Then, and without warning, you get the best picks and your build is awesome only for someone to build the one build that will destroy your build and you lose the game.  It is fun and a waste of time but it is free so heck, why not.  I also am not a fan of the lack of achievements, but it really doesn't change things or make me have to buy stuff so I don't count that against them overall.  For a free game I would pick it up.
A full game doesn't take that much time which is nice, and there a bunch of fun combinations

OMG THIS GAME IS SO GOOD AND ITS FREE! just maybe adding another wsy to battle would be better. P.S. The physicsl card game of this takes so long to ship so AHHHHHHH. 6 or 7 Stars or whatever they say nowadays

An awesome game, very fun, it has simple mechanics and also a lot of strategic depth. Don't be fooled by the funny emoji-like pets, this game is easy to pick up but very hard to master. All in all probably my favorite game for the past couple of months.

Simple game that's easy to get into, satisfying to play, and fill with endless possibilities for creating comps. I would boot this up while there's downtime between classes, or when I just need a quick break. For anyone who plays on laptop, this game also worked very well on my 2019 Dell Inspiron!
Cutest emoji auto battler yet with mobile crossplay, the steam page is self explanatory, a must try alone or with friends.

games alright, although the characters in this game seem to be unaddressedly similar to other ip's found in the animal kingdom. I dont know if anyone else has noticed this phenomenon but I just want to put that out there in case you are not interested in supporting games that steal from other ip's. other than that games pretty silly :p
A charming and deeply strategic auto-battler where you build a team of pets, combine their abilities, and compete against other players. Its simple turn-based loop hides immense strategic depth.

Easy to learn, hard to master. Get used to the RGN, you'll think games are too unfair at times. Don't recommend any of the add-on/"purchase only" upgrade packages until you're VERY familiar with the base set of animals.
so fun! very silly but you know what you are getting into. I love how it is free and that you can customize your pets.
Cute little duel game almost like playing super simple MTG
I've now made two of my work colleagues addicted to this to the point they won't stop yapping about it.
The game has a very satisfying feel to it that makes you keep trying new things and keep coming back to it.
very fun, lots of replay value
what if they added a bald canadian to the game wouldn't that be funny
Great game for free and you can sex dogs!!!!
Awesome time waster for doctor's offices!  So cute~<3
so good game, very yummy looking animals
Excellent game, very replayable.
Really good game to play with friends
Quite possibly the peak of all human achievements.

peak game, even my gradma could play this

Seeing cute and funny little animals hurt eachother brings me joy.

This game here is one of the gems amongst a pile of polished rocks. I've been playing Super Auto Pets (SAP) for years. It's a very good auto-battler. The Developer's keep the game up to date. They tend to create more content and release more Packs (DLC) at least once a year. The way you can use the abilities of your Pets to manipulate the outcomes of a match in your favor feels great.I suggest this for people who like auto-battlers. Also, for those who just want an easy to play game that you can leave and come back to if you get busy. Works well because if something comes up then you can just exit the game and come back later to finish a run.
IMO the game is a 8.5/10.  If it wasn't good then I wouldn't have so many hours playing it.

I can start with this probably isn't for everyone, and winning is not a common place for me in this game. HOWEVER, it is very cute, feels pretty mindless to me, and somehow makes me continue to try to win even when I haven't in like 50 rounds.
this game is good for critical thinking but one downside, it gets old pretty fast.

Fun game that is extremely addictive. I've sunk hundreds of hours into it, and probably will continue to sink more. Appreciate that the devs continue to add content and balance, but it seems like they are never going to be finished with that and it feels a bit cash grabby.
Super Auto Pets is a chill, fun gameâ€”perfect for killing time while waiting for a friend to join vc.

This might just be the perfect game.  Nearly infinite depth but also nearly infinite breadth, a great competitive community, and what seems like luck but is really the intersection of chess and poker.  Play versus once you're ready.
Ridiculous amount of fun and replayability for a free game. Definitely try it out.

Super Auto Pets is already very fun and addictive. The cute animal designs and simple rules make it easy to learn, but building a powerful team requires real strategy. Even though I lost a few rounds, I always wanted to try just "one more game" with a new team combination. A great game for short play sessions. Definitely recommend!

This is the best free game I have ever played, hands down. Weekly packs to keep you hooked, and I just beat my husbands team from his own game 20 minutes earlier so that was a lovely surprise! Run, don't walk, to that download button!!! Also, the giraffe sound effects in this game are eerily realistic, props to the audio engineer for that one.
Addictive,strategic,extremely fun,endless possibilities and quite balanced.Highly recommended!

This is an abstract and cute team-building game for an advancing series of automatic battles, and a tremendous number of interesting custom parameters (if you're willing to buy the DLC packs). Your team is copied by the server to serve an obstacle for later players of the same format, as others were for your run. SAP is one of the older and cheaper (free) roguelikes on Steam. Lobby play is fun, as long as you don't dwarf your partner in general experience. If you go for stalemates with the default deck you end up in a special hell full of mutually assured destruction teams.

If you want to waste some time this game is pretty fun.  It is also super frustrating as you keep getting the worst picks over and over again.  Then, and without warning, you get the best picks and your build is awesome only for someone to build the one build that will destroy your build and you lose the game.  It is fun and a waste of time but it is free so heck, why not.  I also am not a fan of the lack of achievements, but it really doesn't change things or make me have to buy stuff so I don't count that against them overall.  For a free game I would pick it up.
A full game doesn't take that much time which is nice, and there a bunch of fun combinations

An awesome game, very fun, it has simple mechanics and also a lot of strategic depth. Don't be fooled by the funny emoji-like pets, this game is easy to pick up but very hard to master. All in all probably my favorite game for the past couple of months.

Simple game that's easy to get into, satisfying to play, and fill with endless possibilities for creating comps. I would boot this up while there's downtime between classes, or when I just need a quick break. For anyone who plays on laptop, this game also worked very well on my 2019 Dell Inspiron!
Good game with animals. They should add a chicken pet and call it chickentest3 and make the buff writing the emancipation proclamation. Or just add boswer to the game
Its a pretty fun game, highly recommend. It takes some time to learn some of the strategies, but really its mostly based on luck.

My fave auto battler. Simple; easy to understand, jump right in and losing doesn't feel terrible. Winning and becoming an expert is REALLY rewarding and RNG mechanics are well balanced to not feel like good runs are impossible.

Didnâ€™t expect to enjoy it this much. I still donâ€™t fully understand which pet counters which, thought the kangaroo would be a star, but the worm ended up being insanely strong! The visuals and mechanics are super cute and surprisingly deep once you start experimenting.

Its weird I already have nostalgia for this game. I loved the early basics of the game, and there has been so many new animals added to build up your roster over time. Super fun, chill, quick game and you can get really technical with it if you would like.
 
Also the soundtrack SLAPS

negative.review: I have to pay for a subscription for hats now. That was the only "reward" in this game and they put a subscription behind it. Classy move guys. Really a big brain move to take away the only motive to play it.

I like that the game uses emojis as the sprites (which I only realized long after first playing). The gameplay is fairly complex too (it's an autobattler), especially given the simple artstyle. I understand where its coming from, but I do dislike the game's monetization style. I'm definitely a completion-minded person, so the way it's handled is a bit of a bummer to me. My main issue with this game is that it gives me a vague sense of unease. I don't really know why, but it makes me unhappy. Sorry.
I used to love this game. nothing new added other than paywall content. it's not even fun anymore.
absolutely insane dlc prices. should be 10 dollars for everything.

screw this game this is some meritless calvinist predestined bullcrap winning or losing is ENTIRELY out of your control. it doesnt matter how optimized your build is or what win-con you go for, it doesnt fricking matter because ultimately luck will determine whether or not you go against an objectively larger sum math problem than you had the resources make or a deck that just completely counters yours. this game is horse crap and its not worth the price they ask for it
never has a game pissed me off so much
Pay to win. All non-basic pet packs cost real money. $5 to $40 (Canadian? USD? Not sure.) per pack.
Horrible what the fuck is the deer dude like be so fucking fr #killnazmay
No offline mode, players and bots cheat. Don't waste your time.

I started playing this game on mobile and even bought all the additional paid packs, so Iâ€™d say Iâ€™m a pretty long-time player.

At first, the game was genuinely fun and had a good balance of challenge and randomness. But as more updates came out, the manipulation behind wins and losses became increasingly obvious. Youâ€™ll often face opponents with insanely high stats and completely unreasonable win rates. Sometimes, youâ€™ll lose because the enemy miraculously survives with just a sliver of health â€” once or twice it feels dramatic and memorable, but when it happens constantly, it starts to feel scripted rather than coincidental.

This problem has gotten much worse in the latest versions. You can clearly feel the matchmaking pushing you â€” suddenly matching you against much stronger opponents just to break your streak, or pairing you with absurdly weak ones after a losing run. I know games like this often tweak matchmaking behind the scenes, but the current version takes it way too far.

Leaving this review before uninstalling it from both my phone and PC.

I would not recommend Super auto Pets unless you have some spare steam cash to throw around. 
The game is frequently updated, and I greatly enjoyed the game when it came out, however the dlc quickly became the only way to play and or win. Getting far at all with the original pets granted at the beginning, or any of the recent unbalanced weekly free packs, takes more patience then I can muster here. 

The main complaint I would have is the balance. This game does not feel balanced, you will often lose lives and entire runs to individuals who have item/pets you cannot understand without extensive research on the pets, and cannot own yourself without paying money. 

Weekly packs are a wonderful idea to give F2P players a chance. but in my opinion balance is an afterthought on free content. Going through the newest weekly pack shocked me, as almost every pet only had abilities related to selling them or others midgame. tier 1 pets with sell abilities are wonderful as you have to replace them anyway. teir 5 pets with sell abilities related to selling LEVEL 3 pets (6 of the same pet bought at 3 gold][ 10ishgold max per round) is just unfortunate. what am I supposed to do with that pet, Especially if that only adds 1-3 health to SOME of my pets IF i can sell a high enough level pet. 

In summary the game can be fun, but once balance tips most games never recover. and tipping towards Pay 2 win loses my vote for sure.
After countless hours, I can safely say this game is useless. The algorithm is strangeâ€”itâ€™s never on your side, and if you have a specific strategy, it actively works against you.

I don't know if I like this game or if I'm just stubborn. It took me almost a week to win a full 10 rounds, which I feel is a bit excessive. Most of the packs are hidden behind a paywall. And the game isn't nearly expansive enough to validate spending $50+ on the bonus packs--which is the easiest way to win.

We need to know exactly how Arena works. Seems like it's predetermined on some statistics based thing. Or it links up people with oppositely combative teams. Most people I see online complain about this first 100 games or so. None of them seem to be winning, no matter how much they know about the game. Will make new account and test. Seems fishy. Really fishy. I was winning nonstop until an update happened, I see a bunch of people complaining about not winning anymore, and I don't think it has to do with chalk-munching, glue-eating mobile players hardcore meta researching on Reddit. I think the devs did something fishy. Fix it.
It was a cool game while it was in development and it was regular Rogue Lite. Now its trash.

I like that the game uses emojis as the sprites (which I only realized long after first playing). The gameplay is fairly complex too (it's an autobattler), especially given the simple artstyle. I understand where its coming from, but I do dislike the game's monetization style. I'm definitely a completion-minded person, so the way it's handled is a bit of a bummer to me. My main issue with this game is that it gives me a vague sense of unease. I don't really know why, but it makes me unhappy. Sorry.
Game is pay to win. I dont have access to 90% of the pets I go up against. Not to mention the absolutely insane dlc prices. should be 10 dollars max. Game is a waste of time.
I used to love this game. nothing new added other than paywall content. it's not even fun anymore.

I have to pay for a subscription for hats now. That was the only "reward" in this game and they put a subscription behind it. Classy move guys. Really a big brain move to take away the only motive to play it.

this game SUCKS not fair when you are a noob bad food and almost all you get is pets that kill you own pets bad game i dont care if you like it it fucking sucks

The main complaint I would have is the balance. This game does not feel balanced, you will often lose lives and entire runs to individuals who have item/pets you cannot understand without extensive research on the pets, and cannot own yourself without paying money. 

Weekly packs are a wonderful idea to give F2P players a chance. but in my opinion balance is an afterthought on free content. Going through the newest weekly pack shocked me, as almost every pet only had abilities related to selling them or others midgame. tier 1 pets with sell abilities are wonderful as you have to replace them anyway. teir 5 pets with sell abilities related to selling LEVEL 3 pets (6 of the same pet bought at 3 gold][ 10ishgold max per round) is just unfortunate. what am I supposed to do with that pet, Especially if that only adds 1-3 health to SOME of my pets IF i can sell a high enough level pet. 

In summary the game can be fun, but once balance tips most games never recover. and tipping towards Pay 2 win loses my vote for sure.
After countless hours, I can safely say this game is useless. The algorithm is strangeâ€”itâ€™s never on your side, and if you have a specific strategy, it actively works against you.

I don't know if I like this game or if I'm just stubborn. It took me almost a week to win a full 10 rounds, which I feel is a bit excessive. Most of the packs are hidden behind a paywall. And the game isn't nearly expansive enough to validate spending $50+ on the bonus packs--which is the easiest way to win.

We need to know exactly how Arena works. Seems like it's predetermined on some statistics based thing. Or it links up people with oppositely combative teams. Most people I see online complain about this first 100 games or so. None of them seem to be winning, no matter how much they know about the game. Will make new account and test. Seems fishy. Really fishy. I was winning nonstop until an update happened, I see a bunch of people complaining about not winning anymore, and I don't think it has to do with chalk-munching, glue-eating mobile players hardcore meta researching on Reddit. I think the devs did something fishy. Fix it.
It was a cool game while it was in development and it was regular Rogue Lite. Now its trash.

I like that the game uses emojis as the sprites (which I only realized long after first playing). The gameplay is fairly complex too (it's an autobattler), especially given the simple artstyle. I understand where its coming from, but I do dislike the game's monetization style. I'm definitely a completion-minded person, so the way it's handled is a bit of a bummer to me. My main issue with this game is that it gives me a vague sense of unease. I don't really know why, but it makes me unhappy. Sorry.
Game is pay to win. I dont have access to 90% of the pets I go up against. Not to mention the absolutely insane dlc prices. should be 10 dollars max. Game is a waste of time.
I used to love this game. nothing new added other than paywall content. it's not even fun anymore.

I have to pay for a subscription for hats now. That was the only "reward" in this game and they put a subscription behind it. Classy move guys. Really a big brain move to take away the only motive to play it.
Its A pay to win game that they'll probably say it's just a game of "Luck" . there is no such thing as luck
this game SUCKS not fair when you are a noob bad food and almost all you get is pets that kill you own pets bad game i dont care if you like it it fucking sucks
The mechanics are neat, but there just some bullshit abilities in the game.

screw this game this is some meritless calvinist predestined bullcrap winning or losing is ENTIRELY out of your control. it doesnt matter how optimized your build is or what win-con you go for, it doesnt fricking matter because ultimately luck will determine whether or not you go against an objectively larger sum math problem than you had the resources make or a deck that just completely counters yours. this game is horse crap and its not worth the price they ask for it
never has a game pissed me off so much
No offline mode, players and bots cheat. Don't waste your time.
Pay to win. All non-basic pet packs cost real money. $5 to $40 (Canadian? USD? Not sure.) per pack.

the balancing system is horrible, have 2 pets? easy. 5 pets? okay, now fight god. 4.5/10

I started playing this game on mobile and even bought all the additional paid packs, so Iâ€™d say Iâ€™m a pretty long-time player.

At first, the game was genuinely fun and had a good balance of challenge and randomness. But as more updates came out, the manipulation behind wins and losses became increasingly obvious. Youâ€™ll often face opponents with insanely high stats and completely unreasonable win rates. Sometimes, youâ€™ll lose because the enemy miraculously survives with just a sliver of health â€” once or twice it feels dramatic and memorable, but when it happens constantly, it starts to feel scripted rather than coincidental.

This problem has gotten much worse in the latest versions. You can clearly feel the matchmaking pushing you â€” suddenly matching you against much stronger opponents just to break your streak, or pairing you with absurdly weak ones after a losing run. I know games like this often tweak matchmaking behind the scenes, but the current version takes it way too far.

Leaving this review before uninstalling it from both my phone and PC.

I would not recommend Super auto Pets unless you have some spare steam cash to throw around. 
The game is frequently updated, and I greatly enjoyed the game when it came out, however the dlc quickly became the only way to play and or win. Getting far at all with the original pets granted at the beginning, or any of the recent unbalanced weekly free packs, takes more patience then I can muster here.

In summary the game can be fun, but once balance tips most games never recover. and tipping towards Pay 2 win loses my vote for sure.
